question.title: Print Valid String
question.content:
You are given a string ‘S’ consisting of lowercase alphabets, “(“ and “)”. You need to remove the minimum number of parentheses to make the string valid and print that valid string.

A string is valid iff:

1. It is an empty string, it contains lowercase alphabets only, or
2. It can be written as (S), where ‘S’ is the valid string.
3. It can be written as AB (‘A’ concatenated with ‘B’), where ‘A’ and ‘B’ are valid strings.
For example :
Let string be: “co(di()ng”
The valid string can be: “co(di)ng” or “codi()ng”.
Input Format :
The first line of input contains an integer ‘T’, denoting the number of test cases.

The first line of each test case contains a string ‘S’.
Output Format :
For each test case, print a valid string. There are multiple answers possible, you may print any of them.

Print output of each test case in a separate line.
Note :
You do not need to print anything. It has already been taken care of. Just implement the given function.
Constraints :
1 <= T <= 10
1 <= |S| <= 10^5

Where |S| represents the length of the string ‘S’.    

Time Limit: 1 sec
Sample Input 1 :
2
co(di()ng
nin())jas
Sample Output 1 :
co(di)ng
nin()jas
Explanation For Sample Output 1 :
For test case 1: 
The valid string can be: “co(di)ng” or “codi()ng”.

For test case 2: 
The valid string will be: “nin()jas”.
Sample Input 2 :
2
st()))ick
abc
Sample Output 2 :
st()ick
abc

rephrased.body:
Given a string 'S' consisting of lowercase alphabets, '(' and ')', remove the minimum number of parentheses to make the string valid. A valid string satisfies the following:

1.  It is an empty string or contains only lowercase alphabets.
2.  It can be written as (S), where 'S' is a valid string.
3.  It can be written as AB, where 'A' and 'B' are valid strings (concatenation).

Return any valid string that can be formed by removing the minimum number of parentheses.
constraints: Where |S| represents the length of the string ‘S’.

testcases.explanation: The given string 'co(di()ng' can be made valid by removing one of the ')' . So a valid string can be "co(di)ng" or "codi()ng"
The given string 'nin())jas' can be made valid by removing one of the ')' . So a valid string can be "nin()jas"
The given string 'st()))ick' can be made valid by removing one of the ')' . So a valid string can be "st()ick"
The string is already valid as it contains only lowercase letters.

hints: Try to check all the possibilities by removing the brackets.
Try to store the indices of the imbalanced brackets.
Try to store the count of open brackets.
